intro: Ponthieva guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan sedge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually brown or reddish in color. Ponthieva guatemalensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
